original_title: Sri Lanka Supreme Court declines to hear case on DDR
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Supreme Court declined to hear a case against the restructuring of debt in the Employees Provident Fund after two days of argument.
“We are inclined to not take up the case,” Justice Vijith Malalgoda said Friday.

Petitioner said the singling out the Employees Provident Fund was not fair and that court had jurisdiction to hear the case despite the parliament passing a motion to approve the debt restructuring as it was not actual legislation.
Counsel for the Central Bank Governor said the offer to restructure debt came from a series of events which was linked to public finance, which came under the control of the governor.
Counsel for the Treasury Secretary said a halting of debt restructuring will lead to an ” apocalyptic collapse” of the country. (Colombo/Aug11/2023)
